title: Ticket #3236: ENABLE_VERSIONED_OPSYS config knob is ignored.
description: the ENABLE_VERSIONED_OPSYS config knob no longer works on Windows, possibly broken on other platforms as well. Reported on condor-users.
remarks:
2012-Sep-25 17:26:16 by johnkn:
after some digging, I've come to the conclusion that this may not be worth fixing. there's a trivial one-line change that makes it work after a reconfig. but the value of opsys ignores this knob on daemon startup.

the problem is that we can't actually query the value of the knob until after the param system has been initialized, but at that point it's too late, the value of OPSYS has already been initialized into the param system.

I'm changing the target of this ticket to 7.8.6, and may yet punt it entirely.

2012-Oct-25 17:52:16 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070806 to v070807 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2012-Dec-19 09:30:47 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070807 to v070808 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2013-Mar-28 17:16:00 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070808 to v070809 using ./ticket-target-mover.
creator: johnkn
